Description: Fragment from rim of pottery mortarium. Yellow-beige clay, fairly dense and hard. Graffito on outside wall below rim: ]λλωνος[.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Found 40 feet from the sanctuary?
Curator's comments: Marked in pencil inside, possibly reads '40 ft W out temp Ap'.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 61, pl. XXXII, no. 79)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 646, no. 40, pl. 18.1.2)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 55, Table 1, Nauk 68)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p.39 fig.22, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HA.06)
Spataro and Villing 2009 / Scientific investigation of pottery grinding bowls from the Archaic and Classical Eastern Mediterranean (p.91, fig.3, p.93, table.1, p.95, p.96, p.97, fig.8, p.98) (N4)
